FAQ.question: What is an Encumbrance Certificate?
FAQ.answer: An EC lists registered charges (mortgages, liens) on a property during a specified period and helps confirm title is clear.

FAQ.question: What details are required to fetch an EC?
FAQ.answer: You need district/SRO, survey/plot number or document numbers and the date range for which EC is required.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to get EC?
FAQ.answer: If records are digital it can be generated instantly; otherwise it may take 1â€“3 working days.

FAQ.question: Can EC show all types of liabilities?
FAQ.answer: EC shows formally registered charges; informal or unregistered claims may not appear.

FAQ.question: Is EC sufficient to prove clear title?
FAQ.answer: EC is critical but full title audit also requires mutation, sale deed, and revenue records.
